trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database Business Continuity Overview
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database Business Continuity Overview

trans-unit.source: Learn the built-in features and available options of Azure SQL Database that help keep your mission critical cloud applications running and help you recover from outages and errors.
trans-unit.target: Learn the built-in features and available options of Azure SQL Database that help keep your mission critical cloud applications running and help you recover from outages and errors.

trans-unit.source: Business Continuity Overview
trans-unit.target: Business Continuity Overview

trans-unit.source: Business continuity is about designing, deploying and running your application in a way that it is resilient to planned or unplanned disruptive events that result in permanent or temporary loss of the application’s ability to conduct its business function.
trans-unit.target: Business continuity is about designing, deploying and running your application in a way that it is resilient to planned or unplanned disruptive events that result in permanent or temporary loss of the application’s ability to conduct its business function.

trans-unit.source: The unplanned events range from human errors to permanent or temporary outages to regional disasters that could cause wide scale loss of facility in a particular Azure region.
trans-unit.target: The unplanned events range from human errors to permanent or temporary outages to regional disasters that could cause wide scale loss of facility in a particular Azure region.

trans-unit.source: The planned events include application redeployment to a different region, application upgrades etc. The goal of business continuity is for your application to continue to function during these events with minimal impact on the business function.
trans-unit.target: The planned events include application redeployment to a different region, application upgrades etc. The goal of business continuity is for your application to continue to function during these events with minimal impact on the business function.

trans-unit.source: To discuss the business continuity solutions there are several concepts you need be familiar with.
trans-unit.target: To discuss the business continuity solutions there are several concepts you need be familiar with.

trans-unit.source: **Disaster recovery (DR):** a process of restoring the normal business function of the application
trans-unit.target: **Disaster recovery (DR):** a process of restoring the normal business function of the application

trans-unit.source: **Estimated Recovery Time (ERT):** The estimated duration for the database to be fully available after a restore or failover request.
trans-unit.target: **Estimated Recovery Time (ERT):** The estimated duration for the database to be fully available after a restore or failover request.

trans-unit.source: **Recovery time objective (RTO)** – maximum acceptable time before the application fully recovers after the disruptive event.
trans-unit.target: **Recovery time objective (RTO)** – maximum acceptable time before the application fully recovers after the disruptive event.

trans-unit.source: RTO measures the maximum loss of availability during the failures.
trans-unit.target: RTO measures the maximum loss of availability during the failures.

trans-unit.source: **Recovery point objective (RPO)** – maximum amount of last updates (time interval) the application can lose by the moment it fully recovers after the disruptive event.
trans-unit.target: **Recovery point objective (RPO)** – maximum amount of last updates (time interval) the application can lose by the moment it fully recovers after the disruptive event.

trans-unit.source: RPO measures the maximum loss of data during the failures.
trans-unit.target: RPO measures the maximum loss of data during the failures.

trans-unit.source: Business continuity scenarios
trans-unit.target: Business continuity scenarios

trans-unit.source: Business continuity addresses the following key scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Business continuity addresses the following key scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Design for business continuity
trans-unit.target: Design for business continuity

trans-unit.source: The application I am building is critical for my business.
trans-unit.target: The application I am building is critical for my business.

trans-unit.source: I want to design and configure it to be able to survive a regional disaster of catastrophic failure of the service.
trans-unit.target: I want to design and configure it to be able to survive a regional disaster of catastrophic failure of the service.

trans-unit.source: I know the RPO and RTO requirements for my application and will choose the configuration that meets these requirements.
trans-unit.target: I know the RPO and RTO requirements for my application and will choose the configuration that meets these requirements.

trans-unit.source: Recover from human error
trans-unit.target: Recover from human error

trans-unit.source: I have administrative rights to access the production version of the application.
trans-unit.target: I have administrative rights to access the production version of the application.

trans-unit.source: As part of regular maintenance process I made a mistake and deleted some critical data in production.
trans-unit.target: As part of regular maintenance process I made a mistake and deleted some critical data in production.

trans-unit.source: I want to quickly restore the data in order to mitigate the impact of the error.
trans-unit.target: I want to quickly restore the data in order to mitigate the impact of the error.

trans-unit.source: Recover from an outage
trans-unit.target: Recover from an outage

trans-unit.source: I am running my application in production and receive an alert suggesting that there is a major outage in the region it is deployed in.
trans-unit.target: I am running my application in production and receive an alert suggesting that there is a major outage in the region it is deployed in.

trans-unit.source: I want to initiate the recovery process to bring it back in a different region to mitigate the impact on the business.
trans-unit.target: I want to initiate the recovery process to bring it back in a different region to mitigate the impact on the business.

trans-unit.source: Perform disaster recovery drill
trans-unit.target: Perform disaster recovery drill

trans-unit.source: Because the recovery from an outage will relocate the application’s data tier to a different region I want to periodically test the recovery process and evaluate its impact on the application to stay prepared.
trans-unit.target: Because the recovery from an outage will relocate the application’s data tier to a different region I want to periodically test the recovery process and evaluate its impact on the application to stay prepared.

trans-unit.source: Application upgrade without downtime
trans-unit.target: Application upgrade without downtime

trans-unit.source: I am releasing a major upgrade of my application.
trans-unit.target: I am releasing a major upgrade of my application.

trans-unit.source: It involves the database schema changes, deployment of additional stored procs etc. This process will require stopping user access to the database.
trans-unit.target: It involves the database schema changes, deployment of additional stored procs etc. This process will require stopping user access to the database.

trans-unit.source: At the same I want to make sure the upgrade does not cause a significant disruption of the business operations.
trans-unit.target: At the same I want to make sure the upgrade does not cause a significant disruption of the business operations.

trans-unit.source: Point In Time Restore
trans-unit.target: Point In Time Restore

trans-unit.source: Point In Time Restore is designed to return your database to an earlier point in time.
trans-unit.target: Point In Time Restore is designed to return your database to an earlier point in time.

trans-unit.source: It uses the database backups, incremental backups and transaction log backups that the service automatically maintains for every user database.
trans-unit.target: It uses the database backups, incremental backups and transaction log backups that the service automatically maintains for every user database.

trans-unit.source: This capability is available for all service tiers.
trans-unit.target: This capability is available for all service tiers.

trans-unit.source: You can go back 7 days with Basic, 14 days with Standard, and 35 days with Premium.
trans-unit.target: You can go back 7 days with Basic, 14 days with Standard, and 35 days with Premium.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Recover from human error](sql-database-user-error-recovery.md) for details of how to use Point In Time Restore.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Recover from human error](sql-database-user-error-recovery.md) for details of how to use Point In Time Restore.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is also available with Basic, Standard, and Premium databases.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is also available with Basic, Standard, and Premium databases.

trans-unit.source: It provides the default recovery option when also database is unavailable because of an incident in the region where your database is hosted.
trans-unit.target: It provides the default recovery option when also database is unavailable because of an incident in the region where your database is hosted.

trans-unit.source: Similar to Point In Time Restore, Geo-Restore relies on database backups in geo-redundant Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: Similar to Point In Time Restore, Geo-Restore relies on database backups in geo-redundant Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: It restores from the geo-replicated backup copy and therefore is resilient to the storage outages in the primary region.
trans-unit.target: It restores from the geo-replicated backup copy and therefore is resilient to the storage outages in the primary region.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to use Geo-Restore.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to use Geo-Restore.

trans-unit.source: Standard Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: Standard Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Standard Geo-Replication is available for Standard and Premium databases.
trans-unit.target: Standard Geo-Replication is available for Standard and Premium databases.

trans-unit.source: It’s designed for applications that can use the capacity of standard service tier but have more aggressive recovery requirements than Geo-Restore can offer.
trans-unit.target: It’s designed for applications that can use the capacity of standard service tier but have more aggressive recovery requirements than Geo-Restore can offer.

trans-unit.source: When the primary database fails you can initiate failover to a non-readable secondary database stored in the DR paired region.
trans-unit.target: When the primary database fails you can initiate failover to a non-readable secondary database stored in the DR paired region.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) for details on how to configure Geo-Replication and to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to failover to the secondary database.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) for details on how to configure Geo-Replication and to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to failover to the secondary database.

trans-unit.source: Active Geo-Replication
trans-unit.target: Active Geo-Replication

trans-unit.source: Active Geo-Replication is available for Premium databases.
trans-unit.target: Active Geo-Replication is available for Premium databases.

trans-unit.source: It’s designed for write-intensive applications with the most aggressive recovery requirements.
trans-unit.target: It’s designed for write-intensive applications with the most aggressive recovery requirements.

trans-unit.source: Using Active Geo-Replication, you can create up to four readable secondaries on servers in different regions.
trans-unit.target: Using Active Geo-Replication, you can create up to four readable secondaries on servers in different regions.

trans-unit.source: You can initiate failover to any of the secondaries in the same way as Standard Geo-Replication.
trans-unit.target: You can initiate failover to any of the secondaries in the same way as Standard Geo-Replication.

trans-unit.source: In addition, Active Geo-Replication can be used to support the application upgrade or relocation scenarios, as well as load balancing for read-only workloads.
trans-unit.target: In addition, Active Geo-Replication can be used to support the application upgrade or relocation scenarios, as well as load balancing for read-only workloads.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [Design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) for details on how to configure Geo-Replication and to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to failover to the secondary database.
trans-unit.target: Refer to [Design for business continuity](sql-database-business-continuity-design.md) for details on how to configure Geo-Replication and to [Recover from an outage](sql-database-disaster-recovery.md) for details of how to failover to the secondary database.
